analyzed: bam po dang bo; thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo // bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dri ma med pa'i nam mkha' dpal gyi rgyal po mi mtshungs pa'i spyan yon tan shin tu bzang po dpal gyi 'od me tog padmo bee d'urya'i 'od zer sku gzugs rin chen dri mchog dam pas mchod pa gtsug tor smin mtshams
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One!🔽Homage to the Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, the King of Glorious Stainless Space, with incomparable eyes, of extremely good qualities, the glory of light, the flower of the sun and moon, the radiance of the light rays of vaiḍūrya, adorned with the supreme pure fragrance of the body, adorned with the crest of the supreme uṣṇīṣa,

original: mchog gis brgyan pa nyi zla grangs med pa bzhin du snang ba smon lam gyis rab tu brgyan par sprul pa shin tu mnga' ba chos kyi dbyings las byung ba chags pa med pa'i rgyal po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mchog gis brgyan pa nyi zla grangs med pa bzhin du snang ba smon lam gyis rab tu brgyan par sprul pa shin tu mnga' ba chos kyi dbyings las byung ba chags pa med pa'i rgyal po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: illuminating like countless suns and moons, emanated with the adornment of aspirations, the lord of the unattached arising from the dharmadhātu.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa smin mtshams nyi ma bzhin du 'bar ba rin chen zla ba me tog padmo gser stug po lta bu'i sku rnam par snang bas thogs pa med pa'i spyan mang po phyogs bcur 'od zer gyis khyab par mdzad cing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad🔽du snang ba'i dpal gyi rgyal po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa smin mtshams nyi ma bzhin du 'bar ba rin chen zla ba me tog padmo gser stug po lta bu'i sku rnam par snang bas thogs pa med pa'i spyan mang po phyogs bcur 'od zer gyis khyab par mdzad cing 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang ba'i dpal gyi rgyal po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Tathāgata whose eyes, like the sun shining between the eyebrows, are unobstructed, pervading the ten directions with light, illuminating all world systems with a body as radiant as a jewel, the moon, a lotus, or thick gold.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dzambu'i gling gi rdul phra mo snyed kyi bskal pa chen por 'khor ba las mtshan tsam 'dzin ma lus pa thar pa la phyag 'tshal lo //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa snying rje'i 'od zar chos rgya mtsho'i 'od zer snyed sgrog pa'i dbyangs kyi rgyal po la phyag 'tshal lo //

translated: Homage to the Tathāgata who, in great eons equal to the number of atoms in the Rose Apple Land, liberates all those who merely hear his name from saṃsāra.🔽Homage to the Tathāgata whose light rays of compassion emit the sound of the ocean of Dharma, the king of melodies.

translated: Homage to Tathāgata Dharmasvabhāvaniyata.🔽“Those who uphold,🔽recite, master,

original: rjes su dran zhing bsgoms na /
analyzed: rjes su dran zhing bsgoms na /
translated: recall, and meditate on these many names of the Tathāgata, which arise from limitless and countless merits,

original: de dag la mig nad med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag la mig nad med par 'gyur /

original: rna ba'i nad med /🔽sna nad med /
analyzed: rna ba'i nad med / sna nad med /

original: lce nad med /
analyzed: lce nad med /

original: lus nad med cing sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'byang /
analyzed: lus nad med cing sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'byang /
translated: no body disease, and will be purified of all obscurations.

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis gnod pa byed pa mi 'byung /
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis gnod pa byed pa mi 'byung /
translated: No harm will come from any human or non-human being.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar mi ldog par 'gyur /
translated: They will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: phyogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis @144a *//
analyzed: phyogs thams cad kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis @144a *//
translated: The Blessed Buddhas of all directions

original: dgongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: dgongs par 'gyur /

original: de dag gis de la rtag tu bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sbed par mdzad do //
analyzed: de dag gis de la rtag tu bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sbed par mdzad do //
translated: They will always protect, guard, and hide them.

original: mngon du'am chung du na rmi lam du'ang rung ste /
analyzed: mngon du'am chung du na rmi lam du'ang rung ste /
translated: Whether in person or at the very least in a dream,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas par mngon du ston te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i shes rab dang / thabs la mkhas par mngon du ston te /
translated: they will manifest inconceivable wisdom and skill in means.

original: ci nas myur du ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo mo so sor thob par mdzad do //
analyzed: ci nas myur du ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo mo so sor thob par mdzad do //
translated: They will quickly attain the individual doors of meditative stabilization and retention.

original: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nam yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: They will never be separated from the Blessed Buddhas and the teachings of the Buddha.

original: rin po che'i padmo las rdzus te skye bar 'ong /
analyzed: rin po che'i padmo las rdzus te skye bar 'ong /
translated: They will be born miraculously from a precious lotus.

original: nam yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam yang skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: He will always have the thirty-two marks and eighty signs of a great being.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / spyan lnga dang / sems can smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / spyan lnga dang / sems can smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang /
translated: He will have the superknowledges, the five eyes, the ripening of sentient beings, the purification of the buddhafield, the six perfections, the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless absorptions.

original: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so kun tu rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so kun tu rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: He will have the powers, the fearlessnesses, the specific knowledges, the eighteen qualities unique to the Buddha, great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med tshad med pa gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med tshad med pa gzhan dag dang yang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: They will also possess the other innumerable and limitless qualities of the buddhas.

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di dag gi yon tan dang / grags pa phun @144b sum tshogs pa de bzhin du de dag la'ang yon tan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'di dag gi yon tan dang / grags pa phun @144b sum tshogs pa de bzhin du de dag la'ang yon tan du mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Just as these Bhagavān Buddhas have perfected good qualities and fame, it is not the case that they will not have good qualities.

original: de dag la'ang phun sum tshogs pa ring po mi thogs par 'gyur zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde bar myur du mngon sum par byang chub bar 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spobs pa'i dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de dag la'ang phun sum tshogs pa ring po mi thogs par 'gyur zhing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bde bar myur du mngon sum par byang chub bar 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa spobs pa'i dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: They will also have perfection, and before long they will quickly and easily manifest unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Homage to the Blessed Tathāgata Pratibhānakīrti.

original: nam bdag cag byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa na sems can gang gis nged kyi ming thos sam /
analyzed: nam bdag cag byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa na sems can gang gis nged kyi ming thos sam /
translated: When we have fully awakened to enlightenment, may any sentient beings who hear our names,

original: 'dzin tam / bklags na /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / bklags na /

original: de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog par gyur cig /
analyzed: de dag thams cad phyir mi ldog par gyur cig /

original: mi khom pa brgyad las yongs su 'das shing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mngon sum du dgongs te yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar shog cig /
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad las yongs su 'das shing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mngon sum du dgongs te yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar shog cig /
translated: May I be born in a pure buddha realm, in the presence of all the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and may I be completely free from the eight unfavorable conditions.

original: de nas shi 'phos na'ang lhag mar bcas pas yongs su 'dzin par shog cig /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos na'ang lhag mar bcas pas yongs su 'dzin par shog cig /
translated: And when I die and transmigrate, may I be reborn in the presence of the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfectly awakened Buddha Amitābha.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das par shog cig /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las shin tu 'das par shog cig /
translated: May I be completely free from all fears.

original: gang gis de @145b bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa de dag gis gzungs sngags kyi tshig 'di'ang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zungs shig /
analyzed: gang gis de @145b bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag gi mtshan 'dzin pa de dag gis gzungs sngags kyi tshig 'di'ang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par zungs shig /
translated: Those who uphold the names of these thus-gone ones should also constantly and continuously uphold these dhāraṇī mantras.

original: de ste byang chub sems dpa' byams pa mthong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de ste byang chub sems dpa' byams pa mthong bar 'dod na /
translated: If a bodhisattva wishes to see Maitreya,

original: des ci nus par mchod pa byas te 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: des ci nus par mchod pa byas te 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
translated: he should make offerings to the best of his abilities and recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: kun tu yid gtsang zhing byams pa'i sems su bya /
analyzed: kun tu yid gtsang zhing byams pa'i sems su bya /
translated: He should be completely pure in mind and have loving thoughts.

original: de ste kun tu bzang po mthong bar 'dod na'ang de bzhin mchod de nyis 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ste kun tu bzang po mthong bar 'dod na'ang de bzhin mchod de nyis 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
translated: If he wishes to see Samantabhadra, he should make offerings in the same way and recite [the mantra] two hundred thousand times.

original: de ste'ang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad mthong bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de ste'ang de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad mthong bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to see the Tathāgata Vairocana,

original: de ltar mchod de sum 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mchod de sum 'bum bzla bar bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings in this way and recite [the mantra] three hundred thousand times.

original: kun tu'ang gtsang zhing byams pa'i sems su bcas la nga rgyal dang / dregs pa dang / khro ba dang / sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: kun tu'ang gtsang zhing byams pa'i sems su bcas la nga rgyal dang / dregs pa dang / khro ba dang / sdig pa thams cad dang bral bar bya'o //
translated: One should always be pure and loving, free from pride, arrogance, anger, and all evil.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma mchog 'od gsal dpal gzi brjid snang ba la phyag 'tshal lo //

translated: Then the Tathāgata Vimalaprabhā extended his tongue and covered the trichiliocosm. He addressed the seven hundred million bodhisattvas:

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis gzungs sngags kyi tshig 'di 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / ci nus su mchod par byed pa de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis ji ltar bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do; ;de nas de bzhin gshegs pa dri med 'od gsal la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu
translated: if any son or daughter of noble family upholds, recites, and makes offerings to the words of this dhāraṇī mantra to the best of their ability, all their wishes will be fulfilled by those blessed buddhas.”

translated: among the beginner bodhisattvas wishes to fulfill all their intentions

original: mtshan gsum dben par de @150b bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan dang / gzungs sngags kyi tshig 'di dran par byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi bden pa'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs pas na /
analyzed: mtshan gsum dben par de @150b bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan dang / gzungs sngags kyi tshig 'di dran par byas pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi bden pa'i tshig gis byin gyis brlabs pas na /
translated: should rise early in the morning, make a mandala with cow dung, and make offerings with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, and ointments to the best of their ability. They should avoid crowds and stay in solitude for three days and three nights, recalling the names and dhāraṇī mantras of those thus-gone ones and being blessed by the words of truth of those thus-gone ones.
